Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Necklace (?)
Description: Twenty-seven plates, assembled together through a hole pierced at the bottom of each one. These are taller and narrower than is the norm. The material is typical of the C-Group and, more rarely, of other Nubian cultures such as the A-Group, the Kerma and Pan-Grave cultures. The elements can be enhanced by beads made of carnelian, enamel or ostrich eggshell.
